intro: Duchesnea chrysantha f. leucocephala, commonly known as white-flowered oxalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in native gardens.
